author: Laura Meckler
title: Syrian Refugees Entering the U.S. Is Down to Trickle
text:
WASHINGTON—The U.S. has admitted 11 Syrian refugees in the last five months, a contrast to the final years of the Obama administration, when thousands of Syrian refugees came to the country.
In recent days, President Donald Trump has condemned a suspected chemical-weapons attack in Syria and said he is considering military action. But humanitarian organizations see a contradiction with U.S. refugee policy.
